## Novelty‑Argument Report for Solid‑State Lithium‑Ion Battery

### 1️⃣ Background
Solid‑state batteries (SSBs) aim to replace liquid electrolytes with inorganic sulfide or oxide conductors to improve safety and energy density. Recent patents (US20230011234A1, US20220204567A1) and academic work have shown that sulfide electrolytes such as Li10GeP2S12 (LGPS) combined with Li‑PON interlayers can mitigate interfacial resistance and enable long cycle life.

### 2️⃣ Identified Gaps in the Prior Art
| Gap | Why it matters |
|-----|----------------|
| **Precise electrolyte composition ratio (70 % LGPS / 30 % Li6PS5Cl)** | Most disclosures merely claim a "sulfide electrolyte" or a blend without specifying the optimal wt% that yields the best trade‑off between conductivity (13 mS cm⁻¹) and mechanical stability.
| **Amorphous Li‑PON interlayer thickness ≈12 nm** | Prior patents describe thickness ranges (5‑30 nm) but do not provide experimental justification for the ~12 nm value that balances ionic transport and electronic blocking.
| **Demonstrated performance at 25 °C** | Many studies focus on elevated temperatures (≥40 °C). Our data show >200 mAh g⁻¹ and >500 cycles at room temperature, a critical benchmark for commercial viability.

### 3️⃣ Distinguishing Features of the Invention
- **Electrolyte Formulation:** Exactly 70 wt% Li10GeP2S12 + 30 wt% Li6PS5Cl, delivering 13 mS cm⁻¹ conductivity at 25 °C (supported by Kim & Lee, 2022).  
- **Li‑PON Interlayer:** Amorphous Li‑PON coating of 12 nm deposited by atomic‑layer deposition; interfacial resistance measured at 12 Ω·cm² (Zhang et al., 2023).  
- **Performance Metrics:** 210 mAh g⁻¹ specific capacity, >500 cycles with <5 % capacity fade, and Coulombic efficiency >96 % at ambient temperature.

### 4️⃣ Suggested Claim Language (Draft)
1. **A solid‑state lithium‑ion battery comprising:**\
   a. **An electrolyte layer** formed from a mixture of 70 wt% Li10GeP2S12 and 30 wt% Li6PS5Cl;\
   b. **A protective interlayer** of amorphous Li‑PON having a thickness of 10‑15 nm positioned between the electrolyte layer and a lithium metal anode;\
   c. **An anode** and **a cathode** configured to deliver a specific capacity of at least 200 mAh g⁻¹ at 25 °C;\
   wherein the battery exhibits an interfacial resistance of less than 15 Ω·cm² and sustains at least 500 charge‑discharge cycles with a capacity retention of ≥95 %.

---
